title: German economic confidence slumps on geopolitical tensions | Business | The Guardian
summary: bank of england expected to keep rates on hold .
german growth in 2014 likely to miss forecast .
german economic confidence slides on geopolitical tensions .

documents.title: market summary
text: us markets are in flat to negative territory on opening .
the dow jones is off 0.07 % at 16,557 points , while the nasdaq and s & p500 are broadly flat .
the more dramatic story is on german 's dax , which has extended its losses and is now down 0.74 % at 9113 points , following a worse-than-expected fall in investor confidence .
the bad mood appears to be affecting france 's cac40 , which is down 0.53 % at 4175 points .
but the other big economies of the eurozone seem to have escaped the contagion .
spain 's ibex is up 0.74 % at 10,268 points , while italy 's leading share index is up 0.46 % at 19,551 points the ftse100 is flat at 6631 points .
we are calling it a day now and will return tomorrow for the uk 's inflation report and japanese gdp .
thank you for following and all your comments .
a big event in wednesday 's economic diary is japan 's gdp data .
and the headline number is expected to be bad .

economists have forecast a 7.1 % annualised decline in economic output , a worse result than after the 2011 earthquake and tsunami , although not yet comparable to the shock of the global financial crisis when the economy contracted by 15 % .
but the poor performance stands out against growth in the us and other developed economies .
the main culprit is japan 's consumption tax , which was raised to 8 % from 5 % on 1 april .
this helped boost the economy at the start of the year , as people rushed out to spend to beat the tax , but has since suppressed activity .
the 'supermoon ' rises on monday in nangoku , kochi , japan .
the asahi shimbun/the asahi shimbun via getty imag in a very useful q & a on japan , the ft examines why japan 's problems are more than economic swings and roundabouts .
many people are worried .
not long ago economists were predicting a second-quarter pullback of a little more than 3 % , less than half what they 're forecasting now .
many have revised their estimates down in the past few weeks in response to a string of unexpectedly weak data , particularly on industrial output .
the wall street journal , in its 5 things to watch in japan , thinks that weak gdp data could put pressure on the government to change direction .
the data could intensify debate over whether to ramp up fiscal or monetary stimulus , and whether the government should postpone a two-percentage-point sales tax increase planned for october 2015 .
the gdp figures come at a time of growing doubts about the outlook for the economy .

documents.title: bank of england expected to keep rates on hold
text: when is the bank of england going to raise interest rates ?
that is the question on everybody 's mind ahead of a two-day meeting of the bank 's monetary policy committee starting tomorrow .
the consensus is that the boe will keep interest rates frozen at their record low of 0.5 % .
on wednesday we will get the bank 's quarterly inflation report ; their view on interest-rates will be published on thursday .
mark carney is expected to say that a house price crash remains a risk to the recovery and policymakers must be vigilant to prevent prices getting out of control .
economists polled by reuters expect a rate rise to 0.75 % in the first quarter of 2015 , with a 45 % chance that rates will go up this year .
but it is unlikely the bank will be giving away many clues this week .
james knightley at ing expects the bank of england to stay vague .
the bank of england will acknowledge the strength of the uk economy , but will be ambiguous on when policy may start to be tightened at tomorrow 's inflation report briefing .
the meeting will also put bank of england governor mark carney 's brainchild policy , forward guidance , in the spotlight .
samuel tombs at capital economics is not impressed by this innovation .
guidance does not seem to have provided much fuel to the recovery .

granted , confidence surged after guidance was introduced , and our model of consumer confidence suggests that economic variables alone can not fully explain this but gdp growth has not visibly sped up since august .
despite this sub-par record , we doubt that the mpc is about to abandon its fledgling policy innovation .
the policy is too closely connected to the governor to be disposed of soon
the government could have a battle on its hands if it goes ahead with plans to enforce standardised plain packaging for cigarettes in england .
philip morris , the world 's largest tobacco company , which makes marlboro and chesterfield cigarettes , is ready to sue the government should it implement this law .
philip morris made the threat in a submission to the department of health , seen by reuters .
'standardized packaging ' is a euphemism for government-mandated destruction of property .
it is unlawful , disproportionate , and at odds with the most basic requirements of the rule of law .
there is a very good reason for a tobacco company to be worried about plain packaging : it works .

in australia , smoking levels have fallen at their fastest rate in two decades since the introduction of a law that forced manufacturers to remove all corporate branding and add graphic health warnings to packets .
there is no more parmesan .
they are running low on camembert and finnish butter .
in russia the most visible sign of the country 's economic stand-off with the west are empty supermarket shelves , captured on this blog .
goodbye parmesan photograph : /ilya varlamov/live journal goodbye valio photograph : /ilya varlamov/live journal
the economic slump 0f 2008-09 was the worst since records began , but not quite as bad as previously thought , according to the office for national statistics .
statisticians at the ons have been tweaking their data and found that the uk economy shrank less than previously thought during the 2008-09 recession .
the latest revisions show that british economic output was 4.6 % lower in 2009 than 2007 .
previous estimates put the decline at 5.2 % and 6 % .
the ons has said the average growth rate in the uk economy between 1998-2009 was unchanged at 2.2. % .
the independent 's economics editor ben chu has a good graph .
ben chu ( @ benchu ) here 's the change in @ twitterid estimate of gdp growth rates since its last update in june ( note 0.8pp difference in 2008 ) :
deflation is also a risk for the eurozone 's third largest economy .
italy 's national statistics office has reported that prices fell 2.1 % month-on-month in july , confirming an earlier estimate .
prices are flat on last year .
statisticians say the much steeper monthly drop is explained by summer discounting of clothes and shoes .
but the data has raised further scepticism about mario draghi 's statement that long-term expectations for inflation are well anchored '' , i.e .
their forecasts are solid .

the president of the european central bank last week told eurozone worriers to relax and go to the beach or words to that effect , according to ft markets columnist james mackintosh , who has an interesting take on draghi 's most recent press conference .
expectations anchored ?
not everyone is convinced .
a evans-pritchard ( @ ambroseep ) no risk of deflation whatsoever in italy .
how could anybody make such a frivolous suggestion .
expectations anchored !
amid fears of a slowdown in germany , elsewhere in the eurozone deflation is a big concern .
anxiety levels will not be helped by portugal 's latest economic data , showing that the consumer price index fell 0.7 % in july , compared with the previous month .
average prices have fallen 0.2 % since last year .

weak recovery , falling prices photograph : /statistics portugal portugal 's national statistics agency said downward pressure came from the falling price of food , non-alcoholic , drinks , clothing and footwear .
but portuguese households faced rising costs for housing , water , electricity , gas , alcoholic drinks and tobacco .
germany 's leading share index , the dax , is down 0.37 % at 9148 points following the worse-than-expected economic confidence survey .
the euro has fallen 0.31 % to $ 1.3342 .
fear is back .
a worrying sign .
economists are clearly concerned by the unexpectedly-large fall in german investor confidence in august .
but they are not putting all the blame for germany 's weak economic growth on international events .
carsten brzeski at ing says the german slowdown is homemade and eurozone-made '' .
fear is back .

the german zew just sent more signs of caution , showing the at least financial market participants are increasingly becoming pessimistic it will still take until thursday before the hard facts will be presented but based on all available data the german economy should have stagnated .
a stagnation as such is no reason to get overly concerned .
contrary to a common belief , any stagnation of the economy was not so much the result of crisis in the ukraine and european sanctions on russia .
sure , german exports to russia have nosedived in recent months but they only account for around 3 % of all german exports .
stronger demand from the us and uk has more than offset these export losses .
in fact , net exports will probably have been one of the few growth drivers in the second quarter .
instead , the stagnation should have been rather homemade .
or better : homemade and eurozone-made .

the reversal of the mild-weather-effect on the construction sector , an unusual amount of holidays in may combined with ongoing problems in france and italy should have been the main drivers of the slowdown of the german economy .
looking ahead , today 's zew sends a worrying signal that the growth performance in the second quarter could suddenly morph from a one-off into an undesired trend .
up to now , the fallout of the ukraine crisis has been limited to a general return of uncertainty and a sharp drop in german exports to russia .
obviously , a further escalation of the crisis could start to really hurt the economy .
jennifer mckeown , senior european economist at capital economics , says that germany 's recovery appears to have passed its peak .

august 's drop in the german zew economic sentiment indicator is another worrying sign , particularly as perceptions of current conditions are now weakening sharply too the decline must relate largely to fears about the effects of the ukraine crisis , which could prove short-lived given the recent partial recovery in german equity prices .
but the further confidence falls , the greater the risks to actual economic activity .
indeed , note that the zew current conditions index fell for the second month running to +44.3 - its lowest level since january .
this deterioration mirrors the recent decline in more reliable indicators of business activity such as the german pmi and ifo surveys .
data later this week are likely to reveal that the german economy more or less stagnated in q2 .
while a renewed expansion seems likely in q3 and beyond , the recovery seems to have passed its peak .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) zew current conditions at 7-month low ( 44.3 ) , economic sentiment at 20-month low ( 8.6 ) .
here 's the chart :

documents.title: german growth in 2014 likely to miss forecast
text: here is the full statement on german economic confidence , a survey carried out by the zew centre for economic and social research .
the steep fall in german investor confidence has dragged down the indicator showing investor mood across the whole eurozone .
the decline in economic sentiment is likely connected to the ongoing geopolitical tensions that have affected the german economy by now .

in particular , current figures on industrial production and incoming orders suggest markedly reduced investment activities on the part of german firms against the backdrop of uncertain sales prospects .
since the economy in the eurozone is not gaining momentum either , the signs are that economic growth in germany will be weaker in 2014 than expected .
the assessment of the current economic situation in germany has decreased as well .
the respective indicator has lost 17.5 points and now stands at 44.3 points .
the zew indicator of economic sentiment for the eurozone also declined significantly in august .
the indicator has lost 24.4 points compared to the previous month , now standing at 23.7 points .
the indicator for the current economic situation in the euro area decreased in august by 2.3 points to a value of minus 33.8 points .
industrial production and incoming orders suggest markedly reduced investment activities by german firms '' .
zew are forecasting that economic growth in germany will be weaker than expected for 2014 .

documents.title: german economic confidence slides on geopolitical tensions
text: investor confidence in europe 's biggest economy has slumped : the zew institute 's economic sentiment index fell to 8.6 points , versus 27.1 in july , and far below expectations of 17-18 points .
sanctions against russia are likely to hit northern and central europe hardest .
photograph : /oxford economics/haver analytics an important footnote on sanctions is that some countries will suffer more than others .
latvia , which sends one sixth of its exports to russia , will be far harder hit .
unsurprisingly , geography determines trade flows with russia , meaning that the baltic countries , finland will feel the effects more than southern europe , as this chart neatly illustrates .
germany 's economy ministry is far from the only institution concerned about weakness in the eurozone .
amid the usual anxieties , the ukraine crisis is something of a wild card .
economists at oxford economics think that the impact of the ukraine crisis on the eurozone is unlikely to be too damaging .
although they warn that their forecasting could easily be overtaken by events .
the indirect effects - general loss of confidence - could be worse than the direct effects - damage to trade flows .
if the crisis does have adverse indirect effects , such as a weakening in sentiment , then its stands to reason that those countries with the closest linkages to russia will suffer the most .

however , if we look at the change in the eurozone economies ' economic sentiment indices ( esis ) between may ( when the eurozone measure peaked ) and july , there is no obvious correlation between the size of an individual economy 's change in sentiment and the importance of russia as an export market .
the relationship is no better if we focus on industrial sentiment or alter the period over which we assess changes in sentiment .
all this suggests that the recent easing in eurozone sentiment may not be down to the crisis in ukraine .
the full briefing is available here .

germany 's economy ministry has warned that the ukraine crisis , troubles in the middle east and weakness in the eurozone have weighed on the german economy in the second quarter , although positive growth trends remain intact .
the uncertainties may well weigh more than the effects of the sanctions [ on russia ] .
all in all , the mood in the economy has notably darkened the positive underlying tendency continues to remain intact .
via reuters
prudential has warned that the eurozone continues to grapple with significant unresolved economic and political challenges '' .
the insurer 's statement has just hit the wires , as it publishes its results .
half-year operating profit is up 17 % to £ 1.5bn .
the organisation for economic co-operation and development has also found that germany 's economy has lost momentum , as we highlighted yesterday .
this chart , based on the oecd 's indicator for growth , shows just how far germany 's economy has lost pace since 2011 .
germany 's economy is losing momentum photograph : /oecd
glaxosmithkline 's woes continue to deepen , with fresh allegations that the pharmaceutical company bribed syrian doctors to boost sales of its medicines .

gsk is one of the few firms still supplying drugs to war-torn syria and although the business is small , the charge of bribing medical professionals and officials is extremely damaging in the light of similar allegations from china , poland and jordan .

here are the main allegations set out by reuters : the 6 august email from a person familiar with gsk 's syrian operations said the alleged bribes in its pharmaceuticals business took the form of cash , trips and free medical samples .

gsk has been engaging in multiple corrupt and illegal practices in conducting its pharmaceutical business in syria , '' according to the lengthy email addressed to chief executive andrew witty and judy lewent , chair of gsk 's audit committee .

the email cited names and dates of alleged illicit payments , including the case of a syrian doctor who personally received between $ 200 and $ 300 a month in free samples in exchange for ordering gsk drugs for his hospital and rejecting rival ones .
germany 's economy is slowing down and may have even shrunk in the second quarter .
if that is borne out by gdp statistics on thursday , how will angela merkel respond ?
david marsh , chairman of the london and oxford group , is not expecting a dose of unconventional monetary policy , in the form of quantitive easing .

if german growth really does come under pressure because of worsening geopolitics , then chancellor angela merkel is far more likely to re-invent herself this fall as a disciple of reflationary state spending and tax measures rather than to overcome her supreme distaste for qe-style monetary adventurism .
his full comment is on the wall street journal 's market watch .
good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the world economy , the financial markets , the eurozone and the business world .

europe 's biggest economy is our focus this morning , with a widely-respected survey of economic sentiment expected to show that investor confidence in germany has fallen to its lowest level since december 2012 .
the zew economic sentiment indicator for august is expected to come in around 17-18 , down from 27 in july , the 8th straight month of decline .

a combination of economic sanctions on russia , unrest in the middle east that is weighing on global markets and the lacklustre performance of the rest of the eurozone , has been dampening the mood in germany .
economists polled by reuters are expecting gdp data released on thursday to show that the german economy stagnated in the second quarter , although some are predicting an outright contraction .
apart from that it is a quiet day for economic data .
on the corporate front we are expecting half-year results from the pru at 9.15 .

Germany's economy ministry warns on Ukraine, eurozone weakness.
